00061 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00062 // Macros for memory allocation                                                                   //
00063 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00064 
00065 #define ALLOCATE(N,TYPE)  (TYPE *) malloc((N)*sizeof(TYPE));
00066 #define CHECK(PTR)        if ((PTR)==NULL) { fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory!\n"); exit(1); }
00067 
00068 
00069 #define ALLOCATE1D(PTR,N,TYPE)                  \
00070 {                                               \
00071   PTR = (TYPE *) malloc((N)*sizeof(TYPE));      \
00072   CHECK(PTR);                                   \
00073 }
00074 
00075 
00076 #define ALLOCATE1D_INIT(PTR,N,TYPE,VAL)                                                 \
00077 {                                                                                       \
00078   ALLOCATE1D(PTR,N,TYPE);                                                               \
00079   for (unsigned long int k=0; k<(unsigned long int)(N); k++) PTR[k] = VAL;              \
00080 }
00081 
00082 
00083 #define ALLOCATE2D(PTR,N,M,TYPE)                                        \
00084 {                                                                       \
00085   PTR = (TYPE **) malloc((N)*sizeof(TYPE *));                           \
00086   CHECK(PTR);                                                           \
00087   for (unsigned long int i=0; i<(unsigned long int)(N); i++) {          \
00088     PTR[i] = (TYPE *) malloc((M)*sizeof(TYPE));                         \
00089     CHECK(PTR[i]);                                                      \
00090   }                                                                     \
00091 }
00092 
00093 
00094 #define FREE1D(PTR)                             \
00095   if (PTR!=NULL) free(PTR);
00096 
00097 
00098 #define FREE2D(PTR,N)                                                   \
00099 {                                                                       \
00100   if ((PTR)!=NULL) {                                                    \
00101     for (unsigned long int i=0; i<(unsigned long int)(N); i++)          \
00102       if ((PTR)[i]!=NULL) free((PTR)[i]);                               \
00103     free(PTR);                                                          \
00104   }                                                                     \
00105 }
00106 
00107 
00108 
00109 #define CHECK_BOUNDS(X,DESCR,LBOUND,UBOUND)                     \
00110   { if (((X)<(LBOUND)) || ((X)>=UBOUND)) { fprintf(stderr, "Error: %s out of bounds [%d]!\n", DESCR, X); } }
00111 
00112 
00113 
00114 #define MESSAGES(STATE) { _MESSAGES_ = STATE; }

00127 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00128 // CLASS FuncTable                                                                                //
00129 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00130 
00131 class FuncTable
00132 {
00133  public:
00134   FuncTable() { nfunc = 0; }
00135   ~FuncTable() { }
00136   void Add(char *name, FuncType *f, char *description);
00137   void Execute(char *name, char *arg);
00138   void Help();
00139   FuncType *Lookup(char *name);
00140  private:
00141   int nfunc;
00142   char name[MAX_FUNCTIONS][40];
00143   char description[MAX_FUNCTIONS][200];
00144   FuncType *f[MAX_FUNCTIONS];
00145 };
00146 
00147 void Interpreter(FuncTable *FTABLE);

00162 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00163 // CLASS Fields                                                                                   //
00164 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00165 // ResetPointer    | Reset the buffer pointer                                                     //
00166 // GetNextToken    | Return next token and advance the buffer pointer                             //
00167 // GetMatrix       | Convert a buffer to a 2-dimensional array of char[]                          //
00168 // GetFloatMatrix  | Convert a buffer to a 2-dimensional array of float                           //
00169 // GetIntMatrix    | Convert a buffer to a 2-dimensional array of int                             //
00170 // GetVector       | Convert a buffer to a vector of char[]                                       //
00171 // GetFloatVector  | Convert a buffer to a vector of float                                        //
00172 // GetIntVector    | Convert a buffer to a vector of int                                          //
00173 // Clean           | Free memory occupied by the buffer                                           //
00174 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00175 
00176 class Fields 
00177 {
00178  public:
00179   Fields(char *buffer, const char *delimiters);
00180   ~Fields();
00181 
00182   void ResetPointer();
00183   char *GetNextToken(); 
00184   void Clean();
00185 
00186   // get pointers
00187   char ***GetPointers();
00188 
00189   // convert to matrix
00190   char ***GetMatrix(int *n_rows, int *n_columns);
00191   float **GetFloatMatrix(int *n_rows, int *n_columns);
00192   int **GetIntMatrix(int *n_rows, int *n_columns);
00193 
00194   // convert to vector
00195   char **GetVector(int *n_items);
00196   float *GetFloatVector(int *n_items);
00197   int *GetIntVector(int *n_items);
00198 
00199   // find a token
00200   bool Find(char *s);
00201 
00202  public:
00203   int n_rows, n_columns;
00204   long int buffer_size;
00205   char *buffer;
00206   char *pointer;
00207 };

00228 
00229 struct IntNode
00230 {
00231   int val;
00232   IntNode *next;
00233 };
00234 
00235 class IntList
00236 {
00237  public:
00238   IntList();
00239   ~IntList();
00240   void Print();
00241   void Print(FILE *F);
00242   void Add(int val);
00243   void SortAdd(int val);
00244   bool Match(int *X, int n);
00245 
00246   int n;
00247   IntNode *list;
00248   IntNode *last;
00249 
00250  private:
00251   void FreeList(IntNode *L);
00252 
00253 };

00492 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00493 // TOKENIZING                                                                                     //
00494 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00495 // TokenPreprocess  | Preprocess string before tokenizing                                         //
00496 // CountTokens      | Count the number of tokens                                                  //
00497 // GetNextToken     | Get the next command line token                                             //
00498 // SkipBlank        | Skip all spaces at the beginning of the input string                        //
00499 // Read             | Read a single value from an input string                                    //
00500 // ReadVec          | Process a single vector from an input string                                //
00501 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00502 char *TokenPreprocess(char *inp, char *inp_delims, char out_delim);
00503 int CountTokens(char *s, char TOKEN_DELIM=' ');
00504 char *GetNextToken(char **pBUF, const char *DELIMS);
00505 char *GetNextToken(char **pBUF, char DELIM);
00506 char *GetNextToken(char **inp);
00507 char *SkipBlank(char *inp);
00508 void Read(char *s, float *v);
00509 void Read(char *s, double *v);
00510 void Read(char *s, int *v);
00511 void Read(char *s, long int *v);
00512 void Read(char *s, unsigned long int *v);
00513 void Read(char *s, long long int *v);
00514 template <class T> void ReadVec(char *s, T **vec, long int *n, char sep=' ');
00515 template <class T> void ReadSparseVec(char *s, T **vec, long int *n);
00516 float *ReadFloatVec(char *s, long int *n, char sep=' ');
00517 double *ReadDoubleVec(char *s, long int *n, char sep=' ');

00530 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00531 // VECTOR STATISTICS                                                                              //
00532 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00533 // VectorAvg     | Compute the mean value of vector v of size n                                   //
00534 // VectorStd     | Compute the standard deviation of vector v of size n                           //
00535 // VectorSum     | Compute the sum of the vector elements                                         //
00536 // VectorMax     | Compute the max value of vector v of size n                                    //
00537 // VectorMin     | Compute the min value of vector v of size n                                    //
00538 // VectorTest    | Perform a boolean test on each vector element                                  //
00539 // VectorRange   | Compute the range of a vector                                                  //
00540 // VectorNonZero | Checks if vector <> 0                                                          //
00541 // VectorCount   | Count nonempty values                                                          //
00542 // VectorVariab  | Compute vector variability measure                                             //
00543 // VectorEntropy | Compute vector entropy                                                         //
00544 // Hist          | Histogram                                                                      //
00545 // GetThreshold  | Determine a threshold for an exponentially decreasing distribution             //
00546 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00547 template <class type> type VectorAvg(type *v, int n);
00548 template <class type> type VectorStd(type *v, int n);
00549 template <class type> type VectorSum(type *v, int n);
00550 template <class type> type VectorSumSq(type *v, int n);
00551 template <class type> type VectorDiff(type *v, int n);
00552 template <class type> type VectorProd(type *v, int n);
00553 template <class type> type VectorMax(type *v, int n);
00554 template <class type> type VectorMin(type *v, int n);
00555 template <class type> int VectorTest(type *v, int n, bool (*func)(type));
00556 template <class type> type VectorRange(type *v, int n);
00557 template <class type> bool VectorNonZero(type *X, int n);
00558 template <class type> int VectorCount(type *X, int n);
00559 template <class type> float VectorL2(type *X, int n);
00560 float VectorVariab(float *X, int n);
00561 float VectorEntropy(float *X, int n, int nbins);
00562 float *Hist(float *X, int N, int n_bins, float min=0, float max=0);
00563 float GetThreshold(float *X, int n, int delta);

00573 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00574 // VECTOR OPERATIONS                                                                              //
00575 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00576 // VectorSmooth    | Return a "smoothed" version of vector x                                      //
00577 // VectorSort      | Sort the vector                                                              //
00578 // VectorRank      | Get the vector element ranking information                                   //
00579 // VectorChop      | Change values below a cutoff to NaN                                          //
00580 // VectorNorm      | Normalize vector mean to zero and standard deviation to one                  //
00581 // VectorNormMean  | Normalize vector mean to zero                                                //
00582 // VectorNormRange | Normalize the range of a vector to 1                                         //
00583 // VectorNormSum   | Normalize the sum to 1                                                       //
00584 // VectorNormSum2  | Normalize the sum of squared values to 1                                     //
00585 // VectorCut       | Return a 'cut' of the vector                                                 //
00586 // VectorPrint     | Print vector on screen                                                       //
00587 // Apply           | Apply a vector function to all rows of a matrix                              //
00588 // Pairwise        | Apply a function to all pairs of vectors in a matrix                         //
00589 // HistPairwise    | Apply a function to all pairs of vectors in a matrix & compute distribution  //
00590 // Int2Float       | Convert a vector of integer to a vector of float                             //
00591 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00592 float *VectorSmooth(float *x, int n, int d);
00593 void VectorSort(float *V, int n);
00594 void VectorSort(int *V, int n);
00595 void VectorSort(long int *V, int n);
00596 void VectorSort(unsigned long int *V, int n);
00597 void VectorSort(double *V, long int n);
00598 int *VectorRank(float *V, int n);
00599 int *VectorRank(double *V, int n);
00600 int *VectorRank(long int *V, int n);
00601 void VectorChop(float *x, int n, float cutoff);
00602 template <class type> type* VectorCopy(type *x, unsigned long int n);
00603 template <class type> void VectorNorm(type *x, unsigned long int n);
00604 template <class type> void VectorNormSum(type *x, unsigned long int n);
00605 template <class type> void VectorNormRange(type *x, int n);
00606 void VectorNormMean(float *x, int n);
00607 void VectorNormSum2(float *x, int n);
00608 float *VectorCut(float *X, int n, bool *vert_cut);
00609 float *VectorCut(float *X, int n, long int mask, int *nn);
00610 float *Apply(float **A, int N, int M, float (*func)(float *,int));
00611 float **Pairwise(float **A, int N, int M, float (*func)(float *,float *,unsigned long int));
00612 float **Pairwise(float **X, int Nx, float **Y, int Ny, int M, float (*func)(float *,float *,unsigned long int));
00613 float *HistPairwise(float **A, int N, int M, float (*func)(float *,float *,unsigned long int), int n_bins);
00614 float *HistPairwise(float **A, float **B, int Na, int Nb, int M, float (*func)(float *,float *,unsigned long int), int n_bins);
00615 float *Int2Float(int *x, int n);
00616 template <class type> void VectorPrint(type *X, int n, const char *format, bool *vert_cut=NULL, FILE *output=stdout);

00625 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00626 // VECTOR DISTANCES                                                                               //
00627 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00628 // InnerProduct    | The inner product of two vectors                                             //
00629 // Covariance      | The inner product of two vectors                                             //
00630 // Euclidean       | The euclidean distance                                                       //
00631 // VectorCorr      | Calculate the correlation of two vectors                                     //
00632 // RelativeEntropy | Calculate the relative entropy of distribution p with respect to q           //
00633 // Chi2            | Calculate the chi-square distance for vector x relative to expected values   //
00634 // Chi2std         | Calculate the chi-square distance for vector x relative to mean and stdev    //
00635 // Corr            | Calculate the correlation two vectors (handles NaN values)                   //
00636 // Hamming1        | Calculate the common 'ones' in two vectors                                   //
00637 // Jaccard         | Calculate the Jaccard of two vectors                                         //
00638 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00639 template <class type> type InnerProduct(type *A, type *B, unsigned long int n);
00640 template <class type> type Covariance(type *A, type *B, unsigned long int n);
00641 template <class type> type Euclidean(type *A, type *B, unsigned long int n);
00642 template <class type> double VectorCorr(type *A, type *B, unsigned long int n);
00643 template <class type> type RelativeEntropy(type *p, type *q, unsigned long int n);
00644 template <class type> type Chi2(type *x, type *avg, unsigned long int n);
00645 template <class type> type Chi2std(type *x, type *avg, type *std, unsigned long int n);
00646 float Jaccard(int *A, int *B, int M);
00647 float Corr(float *A, float *B, unsigned long int M);
00648 float Corr(float *A, float *B, unsigned long int *I, unsigned long int M);
00649 int Hamming1(int *x, int *y, int n);

00767 // CLASS CmdOption                                                                                   //

00770 
00771 class CmdOption 
00772 {
00773   public:
00774    CmdOption(const char *opt, const char *description);
00775    virtual ~CmdOption();
00776 
00777    // functions 
00778    virtual void Init();
00779    virtual void Print();
00780    virtual void Read(int *argc, char ***argv);
00781 
00782    // variables   
00783    char *opt;
00784    char *description;
00785 };
00786 
00787 
00788 template <class T> class CmdOptionTemplate : public CmdOption
00789 {
00790   public:
00791    CmdOptionTemplate(const char *opt, T *ptr, T val, const char *description);
00792    ~CmdOptionTemplate();
00793 
00794    // functions 
00795    virtual void Init();
00796    virtual void Print();
00797    virtual void Read(int *argc, char ***argv);
00798 
00799    // variables   
00800    T *ptr;
00801    T val;
00802 };
00803 
00804

00806 {
00807   public:
00808    BoolCmdOption(const char *opt, bool *ptr, bool val, const char *description);
00809    ~BoolCmdOption();
00810 
00811    // functions 
00812    virtual void Init();
00813    virtual void Print();

00815 
00816    // variables

00818    bool val;

00849 class CmdLine
00850 {

00853     typedef list<CmdOption*> OptionList;
00854 
00855     // constructor & destructor    
00856     CmdLine();
00857     ~CmdLine();

00859     // read & print
00860     void SetProgramName(string program_name, string version="");
00861     void Init();
00862     int Read(char **argv, int argc);
00863     void Print();
00864 
00865     // options
00866     void AddOption(CmdOption *option);
00867     void AddOption(const char *opt, char *ptr, char val, const char *description);
00868     void AddOption(const char *opt, int *ptr, int val, const char *description);
00869     void AddOption(const char *opt, unsigned long int *ptr, unsigned long int val, const char *description);
00870     void AddOption(const char *opt, long int *ptr, long int val, const char *description);
00871     void AddOption(const char *opt, bool *ptr, bool val, const char *description);
00872     void AddOption(const char *opt, float *ptr, float val, const char *description);
00873     void AddOption(const char *opt, double *ptr, double val, const char *description);
00874     void AddOption(const char *opt, char **ptr, const char *val, const char *description);
00875 
00876     // print info

00878     void Usage(char *prog_name, const char *usage);
00879 
00880     // data

00971 // Seq2Bag           | Convert a sequence to a bag                                                //
00972 // SeqSort           | Sort a sequence, effectively converting it into a multiset                 //
00973 // SeqCopy           | Create a copy of the sequence                                              //
00974 // SeqUnique         | Converts a sequence into the corresponding set                             //
00975 // SeqIntersect      | Returns the intersection of two multisets                                  //
00976 // SeqUnion          | Returns the union of two sequences                                         //
00977 // SeqProduct        | Returns the inner product of two multisets                                 //
00978 // SeqCheckIntersect | Checks if the intersection of two multisets is not empty                   //
00979 // SeqIsSorted       | Checks if sequence is sorted                                               //
00980 // SeqPrint          | Display                                                                    //

01025 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
01026 // MATRIX OPERATIONS                                                                              //
01027 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
01028 // ColumnConst   | Check whether column vectors are constant                                      //
01029 // ColumnSum     | Compute the sum of the values of the columns of matrix M of size n x m         //
01030 // ColumnAvg     | Compute the mean values of the columns of matrix M of size n x m               //
01031 // ColumnStd     | Compute the standard deviation of the columns of matrix M of size n x m        //
01032 // ColumnMax     | Compute the maximum of the columns of matrix M of size n x m                   //
01033 // ColumnMin     | Compute the minimum of the columns of matrix M of size n x m                   //
01034 // ColumnCount   | Count nonempty values of the columns of matrix M of size n x m                 //
01035 // ColumnNorm      | Normalize column vectors using mean and standard deviation                   //
01036 // ColumnNormMean  | Normalize column vectors to a zero mean                                      //
01037 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
01038 template <class type> bool *ColumnConst(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
01039 template <class type> type *ColumnAvg(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
01040 template <class type> type *ColumnSum(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
01041 template <class type> type *ColumnStd(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
01042 template <class type> type *ColumnMax(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
01043 template <class type> type *ColumnMin(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
01044 int *ColumnCount(float **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
01045 void ColumnNorm(float **M, int n, int m);
01046 void ColumnNormMean(float **M, int n, int m);

01132 class Matrix

01175 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
01176 // CLASS MatrixTemplate                                                            //
01177 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
01178 
01179 template <class T> class MatrixTemplate
01180 {
01181  public:
01182   MatrixTemplate(char *file, bool verbose=false);
01183   ~MatrixTemplate();
01184   
01185   // functions
01186   void Print(char *fmt="%.2f");
01187   void Shrink(char *fmt="%.2f");
01188   void PrintSparse(char *fmt="%.2f", long int offset=0);
01189   void PrintEncoded(int n_bins);
01190   void PrintTranspose(char *fmt="%.2f");
01191   void PrintRowStats(char *fmt="%.2f");
01192   void PrintColStats(char *fmt="%.2f");
01193   void PrintColSums(char *fmt="%.2f");
01194   void PrintRow(int r, char *fmt="%.2f");
01195   void PrintRowPairs(char *fmt="%.2f");
01196   void PrintColLabels();
01197   void ApplyCutoff(T cutoff, bool upper=false);
01198   void Test(T cutoff, bool equal=true, bool greater=true);
01199   void Norm(T avg, T std);
01200   void NormRows(bool range=false);
01201   void NormCols();
01202   void Shuffle(gsl_rng *rnd_generator);
01203   void Multiply(T coeff);
01204   void Rel(bool first_column=false);
01205   void PrintRel2(char *fmt="%.2f");
01206   void Delete(char *fmt, T cutoff, bool equal=true, bool greater=true);
01207 
01208   // data
01209   long int n_rows, n_cols;
01210   bool has_row_labels, has_col_labels;
01211   std::string *row_labels, *col_labels;
01212   T **val;
01213 };
01214 
01215 
01216 //-------Constructor--------
01217 //
01218 template <class T> MatrixTemplate<T>::MatrixTemplate(char *file, bool verbose)
01219 {
01220   // Load file or standard input
01221   FileBuffer *buffer;
01222   long int n_lines;
01223   if (file==NULL) buffer = new FileBufferText(LoadStdIn(&n_lines));
01224   else { buffer = new FileBufferText(file); n_lines = buffer->CountLines(); }
01225   if (n_lines==0) { col_labels = row_labels = NULL; val = NULL; n_rows = n_cols = 0; return; }
01226 
01227   // check/read column labels
01228   char *inp = buffer->Next();
01229   if (strchr(inp,'\t')!=NULL) {
01230     has_row_labels = true;
01231     has_col_labels = inp[0]=='\t';
01232     n_rows = n_lines - has_col_labels;
01233     row_labels = new std::string[n_rows];
01234     if (has_col_labels==true) {
01235       GetNextToken(&inp,'\t');
01236       n_cols = CountTokens(inp,' ');
01237       col_labels = new std::string[n_cols];
01238       for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) col_labels[c] = GetNextToken(&inp,' ');
01239       inp = buffer->Next();
01240     }
01241     else {
01242       col_labels = NULL;
01243       n_cols = CountTokens(inp,' ');
01244     }
01245   }
01246   else {
01247     has_row_labels = has_col_labels = false;
01248     n_rows = n_lines;
01249     n_cols = CountTokens(inp,' ');
01250     col_labels = row_labels = NULL;
01251   }
01252 
01253   // allocate matrix memory
01254   if (verbose) fprintf(stderr, "* Found %ld lines, %ld rows and %ld columns; row labels = %s; column labels = %s.\n", n_lines, n_rows, n_cols, has_row_labels?"ON":"OFF", has_col_labels?"ON":"OFF");
01255   ALLOCATE1D(val,n_rows,T *);
01256 
01257   // read contents
01258   Progress PRG("Reading matrix entries...",n_rows);
01259   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++,inp=buffer->Next()) {
01260     bool row_label_found = strchr(inp,'\t')!=NULL;
01261     if (row_label_found!=has_row_labels) { fprintf(stderr, "Line %ld: row_label_found = %s, has_row_labels = %s\n", r+1+has_col_labels, row_label_found?"YES":"NO", has_row_labels?"YES":"NO"); exit(1); } 
01262     if (has_row_labels) row_labels[r] = GetNextToken(&inp,'\t');
01263     long int n_elem;
01264     ReadVec(inp,&val[r],&n_elem);
01265     if (n_elem!=n_cols) { fprintf(stderr, "Line %ld: vector length should be %ld!\n", r+1+has_col_labels, n_cols); exit(1); }
01266     PRG.Check();
01267   }
01268   PRG.Done();   
01269 
01270   // cleanup
01271   delete buffer;
01272 }
01273 
01274 
01275 
01276 //-------Destructor--------
01277 //
01278 template <class T> MatrixTemplate<T>::~MatrixTemplate()
01279 {
01280   if (row_labels!=NULL) delete [] row_labels;
01281   if (col_labels!=NULL) delete [] col_labels;
01282   FREE2D(val,n_rows);
01283 }
01284 
01285 
01286 
01287 //-------Print--------
01288 //
01289 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Print(char *fmt)
01290 {
01291   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01292     if (has_row_labels) printf("\t");
01293     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01294     printf("\n");
01295   }
01296   Progress PRG("Printing matrix...",n_rows);
01297   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01298     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01299     PrintRow(r,fmt);
01300     printf("\n");
01301     PRG.Check();
01302   }
01303   PRG.Done();   
01304 }
01305 
01306 
01307 
01308 //-------Shrink--------
01309 //
01310 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Shrink(char *fmt)
01311 {
01312   if (n_rows==0) return;
01313   bool *keep = new bool[n_cols];
01314   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) {
01315     keep[c] = false;
01316     for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) if ((val[r][c]==val[r][c])&&(val[r][c]!=0)) { keep[c] = true; break; }
01317   }
01318   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01319     if (has_row_labels) printf("\t");
01320     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) if (keep[c]==true) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01321     printf("\n");
01322   }
01323   Progress PRG("Printing matrix...",n_rows);
01324   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01325     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01326     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) if (keep[c]==true) {
01327       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) printf(fmt, val[r][c]); else printf("NaN");
01328       printf(" ");
01329     }
01330     printf("\n");
01331     PRG.Check();
01332   }
01333   PRG.Done();
01334   delete keep;
01335 }
01336 
01337 
01338 
01339 //-------PrintSparse--------
01340 //
01341 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintSparse(char *fmt, long int offset)
01342 {
01343   Progress PRG("Printing in sparse format...",n_rows);
01344   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01345     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01346     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) 
01347       if ((val[r][c]==val[r][c])&&(val[r][c]!=0)) { printf("%ld:", offset+c); printf(fmt, val[r][c]); printf(" "); } 
01348     printf("\n");
01349     PRG.Check();
01350   }
01351   PRG.Done();
01352 }
01353 
01354 
01355 
01356 //-------PrintEncoded--------
01357 //
01358 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintEncoded(int n_bins)
01359 {
01360   Progress PRG("Printing in encoded format...",n_rows);
01361   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01362     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01363     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) printf("%ld ", (long int)c*n_bins+(long int)val[r][c]);
01364     printf("\n");
01365     PRG.Check();
01366   }
01367   PRG.Done();
01368 }
01369 
01370 
01371 
01372 //-------PrintTranspose--------
01373 //
01374 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintTranspose(char *fmt)
01375 {
01376   if (has_row_labels==true) {
01377     if (has_col_labels) printf("\t");
01378     for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) std::cout << row_labels[r] << ' ';
01379     printf("\n");
01380   }
01381   Progress PRG("Printing matrix...",n_cols);
01382   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) {
01383     if (has_col_labels) std::cout << col_labels[c] << '\t';
01384     for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01385       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) printf(fmt, val[r][c]); else printf("NaN");
01386       printf(" ");
01387     }
01388     printf("\n");
01389     PRG.Check();
01390   }
01391   PRG.Done();   
01392 }
01393 
01394 
01395 
01396 //-------PrintColStats--------
01397 //
01398 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintColStats(char *fmt)
01399 {
01400   // compute statistics
01401   T *sum = ColumnSum(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01402   T *min = ColumnMin(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01403   T *max = ColumnMax(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01404   T *avg = ColumnAvg(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01405   T *std = ColumnStd(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01406 
01407   // print statistics
01408   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01409     printf("\t");
01410     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01411     printf("\n");
01412   }
01413   printf("SUM\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, sum[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01414   printf("MIN\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, min[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01415   printf("MAX\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, max[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01416   printf("AVG\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, avg[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01417   printf("STD\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, std[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01418 
01419   // free memory
01420   FREE1D(sum);
01421   FREE1D(avg);
01422   FREE1D(std);
01423   FREE1D(min);
01424   FREE1D(max);
01425 }
01426 
01427 
01428 
01429 //-------PrintColSums--------
01430 //
01431 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintColSums(char *fmt)
01432 {
01433   // return 0, if matrix is empty
01434   if (n_rows==0) { printf(fmt, 0); printf("\n"); return; }
01435 
01436   // compute statistics
01437   T *sum = ColumnSum(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01438 
01439   // print statistics
01440   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01441     printf("\t");
01442     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01443     printf("\n");
01444   }
01445   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, sum[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01446 
01447   // free memory
01448   FREE1D(sum);
01449 }
01450 
01451 
01452 
01453 //-------PrintRowStats--------
01454 //
01455 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintRowStats(char *fmt)
01456 {
01457   // print statistics
01458   printf("\tSUM\tMIN\tMAX\tAVG\tSTD\tSTD/AVG\tCOUNT\n");
01459   Progress PRG("Printing row statistics...",n_rows);
01460   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01461     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01462     printf(fmt, VectorSum(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01463     printf(fmt, VectorMin(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01464     printf(fmt, VectorMax(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01465     printf(fmt, VectorAvg(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01466     printf(fmt, VectorStd(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01467     printf(fmt, VectorStd(val[r],n_cols)/VectorAvg(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01468     printf("%ld", n_cols);
01469     printf("\n");
01470     PRG.Check();
01471   }
01472   PRG.Done();   
01473 }
01474 
01475 
01476 
01477 //-------PrintRowPairs--------
01478 //
01479 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintRowPairs(char *fmt)
01480 {
01481   Progress PRG("Printing row pairs...",n_rows);
01482   for (long int r1=0; r1<n_rows; r1++) {
01483     for (long int r2=r1+1; r2<n_rows; r2++) {
01484       if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r1] << '\t' << row_labels[r2] << '\t';
01485       PrintRow(r1,fmt);
01486       std::cout << '\t';
01487       PrintRow(r2,fmt);
01488       printf("\n");
01489     }
01490     PRG.Check();
01491   }
01492   PRG.Done();   
01493 }
01494

01497 //-------PrintRow--------
01498 //
01499 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintRow(int r, char *fmt)
01500 {
01501   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) {
01502     if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) printf(fmt, val[r][c]); else printf("NaN");
01503     printf(" ");
01504   }
01505 }

01509 //-------PrintColLabels--------
01510 //
01511 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintColLabels()
01512 {
01513   if (has_row_labels==true) std::cout << '\t';
01514   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01515   std::cout << '\n';
01516 }

01518 
01519 
01520 //-------ApplyCutoff--------
01521 //
01522 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::ApplyCutoff(T cutoff, bool upper)
01523 {
01524   Progress PRG("Applying cutoff...",n_rows);
01525   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01526     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++)
01527       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) {
01528         if (upper) val[r][c] = val[r][c]>cutoff ? cutoff:val[r][c];
01529         else val[r][c] = val[r][c]<cutoff ? cutoff:val[r][c];
01530       }
01531     PRG.Check();
01532   }
01533   PRG.Done();
01534 }
01535 
01536 
01537 
01538 //-------Test--------
01539 //
01540 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Test(T cutoff, bool equal, bool greater)
01541 {
01542   Progress PRG("Applying test...",n_rows);
01543   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01544     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) {
01545       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) {
01546         if ((equal==true)&&(val[r][c]==cutoff)) { val[r][c] = 1; continue; }
01547         if ((greater==true)&&(val[r][c]>cutoff)) { val[r][c] = 1; continue; }
01548         if ((greater==false)&&(val[r][c]<cutoff)) { val[r][c] = 1; continue; }
01549         val[r][c] = 0;
01550       }
01551     }
01552     PRG.Check();
01553   }
01554   PRG.Done();   
01555 }
01556 
01557 
01558 
01559 //-------Delete--------
01560 //
01561 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Delete(char *fmt, T cutoff, bool equal, bool greater)
01562 {
01563   Progress PRG("Deleting rows...",n_rows);
01564   long int *selected = new long int[n_rows];
01565   long int n_selected = 1;
01566   selected[0] = 0;
01567   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01568     if (has_row_labels) printf("\t");
01569     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01570     printf("\n");
01571   }
01572   if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[0] << '\t';
01573   PrintRow(0,fmt);
01574   printf("\n");
01575   for (long int r=1; r<n_rows; r++) {
01576     bool add = true;
01577     for (long int z=0; z<n_selected; z++) {
01578       double corr = VectorCorr(val[r],val[selected[z]],n_cols);
01579       if ((equal==true)&&(corr==cutoff)) { add = false; break; }
01580       if ((greater==true)&&(corr>cutoff)) { add = false; break; }
01581       if ((greater==false)&&(corr<cutoff)) { add = false; break; }
01582     }
01583     if (add==true) {
01584       selected[n_selected++] = r;
01585       if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01586       PrintRow(r,fmt);
01587       printf("\n");
01588     }
01589     PRG.Check();
01590   }
01591   PRG.Done();   
01592   if (_MESSAGES_) fprintf(stderr, "* selected %ld rows.\n", n_selected);
01593   delete selected;
01594 }

01598 //-------Norm--------
01599 //
01600 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Norm(T avg, T std)
01601 {
01602   Progress PRG("Normalizing rows...",n_rows);
01603   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01604     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) val[r][c] = (val[r][c]-avg)/std;
01605     PRG.Check();
01606   }
01607   PRG.Done();
01608 }
01609 
01610 
01611 //-------NormRows--------
01612 //
01613 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::NormRows(bool range)
01614 {
01615   Progress PRG("Normalizing rows...",n_rows);
01616   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01617     if (range) VectorNormRange(val[r],n_cols);
01618     else VectorNorm(val[r],n_cols);
01619     PRG.Check();
01620   }
01621   PRG.Done();
01622 }
01623 
01624 
01625 //-------NormCols--------
01626 //
01627 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::NormCols()
01628 {
01629   T *avg = ColumnAvg(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01630   T *std = ColumnStd(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01631   Progress PRG("Normalizing columns...",n_rows);
01632   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01633     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) 
01634       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) val[r][c] = (val[r][c]-avg[c])/std[c];
01635     PRG.Check();
01636   }
01637   PRG.Done();
01638   FREE1D(avg);
01639   FREE1D(std);
01640 }

01643 //-------Shuffle--------
01644 //
01645 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Shuffle(gsl_rng *rnd_generator)
01646 {
01647   Progress PRG("Shuffling rows...",n_rows);
01648   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01649     gsl_ran_shuffle(rnd_generator,val[r],n_cols,sizeof(T));
01650     PRG.Check();
01651   }
01652   PRG.Done();
01653 }
01654 
01655 
01656 //-------Multiply--------
01657 //
01658 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Multiply(T coeff)
01659 {
01660   Progress PRG("Multiplying...",n_rows);
01661   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01662     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) val[r][c] *= coeff;
01663     PRG.Check();
01664   }
01665   PRG.Done();
01666 }
01667 
01668 
01669 //-------Rel--------
01670 //
01671 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Rel(bool first_column)
01672 {
01673   Progress PRG("Fold enrichment...",n_rows);
01674   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01675     for (long int c=n_cols-1; c>=1; c--) if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) val[r][c] /= first_column==true?val[r][0]:val[r][c-1];
01676     PRG.Check();
01677   }
01678   PRG.Done();
01679 }
01680 
01681 
01682 //-------PrintRel2--------
01683 //
01684 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintRel2(char *fmt)
01685 {
01686   Progress PRG("Fold enrichment...",n_rows);
01687   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01688     printf("\t");
01689     for (long int c0=0; c0<n_cols-1; c0++) 
01690       for (long int c=c0+1; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << '/' << col_labels[c0] << ' ';
01691     printf("\n");
01692   }
01693   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01694     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01695     for (long int c0=0; c0<n_cols-1; c0++) 
01696       for (long int c=c0+1; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, val[r][c]/val[r][c0]); printf(" "); }
01697     printf("\n");
01698     PRG.Check();
01699   }
01700   PRG.Done();
01701 }
